page.title: 06HEALTH IN THORNTON
page.content: ONE OF THE DOCTORS AT THORNTON IS CALLED{ DOCTOR BROADLEY}.HE HAS BEEN IN THORNTON FOR 10 YEARS.THERE ARE 8 DOCTORS AT THE HEALTH CENTRE WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1968.AROUND THORNTON THE COMMONEST ILLNESSES FOR CHILDREN ARE COLDS BUT THE COMMONEST ONES HE HAS TO TREAT ARE MEASLES, CHEST INFECTIONS AND CHICKENPOX.THE MOST USED MEDICINES ARE ANTIBIOTICS. AT THE MOMENT HE HAS ABOUT 2500 PATIENTS.HE TREATS ABOUT 50 A DAY.HIS STETHOSCOPE IS HIS MOST USED INSTRUMENT.IT IS MOSTLY CHILDREN AND OLDER PEOPLE WHO GO TO HIM.HE HAS A LOT OF ELDELY PATIENTS BECAUSE THEY COME HERE TO RETIRE. A LOT OF THE DISEASES WE CURE OURSELVES.HE ENJOYS HIS JOB A LOT. IT TAKES ABOUT 6 YEARS TO TRAIN TO BE A DOCTOR.HE WAS 24 WHEN HE FIRST STARTED HIS SURGERY AND HAS BEEN A DOCTOR FOR 18 YEARS.BY IAN
